title: Adding an exception to server response when there are missing segments
body:
When broker sends a request to server for a segment that does not
exist on server, no message or indication on this is sent back
to broker. This pr adds the exception information in DataTable that
is sent back to broker that it can know if there was any missing
segment from server side while processing the query.

title: Have server wait until no incoming queries nor online table resources during shutdown
body:
This PR adds code to have pinot server wait until it doesn't get any incoming queries within 60 seconds during shutdown. The max waiting time is 10 mins. Add `_latestQueryTime` in ServerInstance to track the latest Query time.
This PR also adds code to wait for the EV update as well. A spectator helix manager is needed to keep track of the EV change.
Unit test added.

title: Improve the way we get instances with a tag from helix
body: Get all instance configs in one shot, and then filter out the instance configs based on tags/enabled. This will avoid exceptions we encounter if an instances is in an inconsistent state (for example present in INSTANCES but not in PARTICIPANTS). This is also more efficient than fetching all instances from INSTANCES first and then fetching each instance config

title: [PINOT-7088] Emit metrics to track when servers are not found segments during query processing
body:
This change is related to https://github.com/linkedin/pinot/pull/3217. 

This change updates broker and server code to indicate the following errors:
1. If a server gets a request for a segment its not hosting. This can happen when broker hasn't processed EV update indicating that the segment has moved off the server.
2. On the broker side, when a EV update results in routing table entries that have no servers for some segments. This could happen during table rebalance when Helix removes a segment from all servers temporarily.

Testing done:
Unit tests exercise the new code; I see log messages for both server and broker side issues.

title: [PINOT-7088] No-downtime table rebalance
body:
Updated logic in #3210. 
Currently, when the controller's rebalance API is called, the idealstate is updated in one go and there are no guarantees around replica availability.

This change provides a way to do no downtime rebalancing. Key changes include:

1. Option to specify via rebalance API whether a downtime is acceptable or not. (By default the code does the safe thing: no-downtime rebalance).
2. Provide a helper class to handle the actual ideal-state update actions. This is moved out of the Strategy classes - perhaps a clearer approach as the Strategy classes just inform what needs to be done and the actual execution is handled outside of the Strategy.
3. IdealStateUpdater class: This class does the no-downtime update using a fixed thread pool - this allows for the API to return the target IdealState to the user and handle the execution in the background. The no downtime aspect is handled thus:
- The ideal state is updated to reflect the target state first ensuring there is atleast one serving replica. For ex, if current state is Segment 1 -> {host1:online, host2:online} and new state is Segment 1 -> {host3:online, host4:online}, we transition through the following changes:
Segment 1 -> {host1:online, host3:online}
Similar transitions for segments that don't have any common replica for the target state are triggered.
- After this the ideal state is set to the target which will result in removing other replicas from the segments: Segment1 -> {host3:online, host4:online}

Testing done:
- Added basic coverage to ensure the one-replica guarantee is maintained.
- TODO: add tests to cover more of the added code.

Manual testing at this point to ensure:
- API return immediately
- Table with ReplicaGroupAssignmentStrategy can be rebalanced correctly when instances per partition are changed (ie, added or removed).
- TODO: Test end to end with realtime segments and DefaultSegmentAssignmentStrategy.
- Manual testing uncovered a problem with partition assignment that is tracked in: https://github.com/linkedin/pinot/issues/3216.

title: [TE] (PINOT-7089) Ability to configure multiple Metadata Sources
body:
**Changes:**
* Added ability to configure multiple metadata sources for each data source.
* Each Metadata source will have their own properties along with inheriting the parent data source properties.

**New Configuration changes:**
```
dataSourceConfigs:
  - className: com.linkedin.thirdeye.datasource.pinot.PinotThirdEyeDataSource
    properties:
        zookeeperUrl: 'dummy-url'
        clusterName: 'dummy-cluster'
        controllerConnectionScheme: 'https'
        controllerHost: 'dummy-host'
        controllerPort: 99999
        d2PinotProxyHost: 'dummy-host'
        d2PinotProxyPort: 9999
        cacheLoaderClassName: dummy-cache
    metadataSourceConfigs:
      - className: com.linkedin.thirdeye.auto.onboard.AutoOnboardDummyDataSource
        properties:
            username: 'username'
            password: 'password'
      - className: com.linkedin.thirdeye.auto.onboard.AutoOnboardAnotherDummyDataSource
        properties:
            host: 'host'
            port: 9999
  - className: com.linkedin.thirdeye.datasource.csv.CSVThirdEyeDataSource
    properties:
        business: business.csv
    metadataSourceConfigs:
      - className: com.linkedin.thirdeye.auto.onboard.AutoOnboardAnotherRandomDataSource
```

**Testing:**
* Added Unit tests

title: [TE] rootcause - faster heatmap via end-to-end topk limit support
body:
This PR extends topk limit support (#3207) end-to-end from frontend to data source in Thirdeye. De-aggregation (breakdown) queries can now provide an upper bound on the number of dimension values to return. The PR further adds support for the rollup of values smaller than the top k into an aggregate 'OTHER' column and adapts the UI to account for these in dimension heat map and table views.

This significantly improves the performance end-to-end from lower load on data sources such as pinot, over processing within ThirdEye's backend, to client-side rendering of dimensional data via heat map or table.

repo.name: pinot
repo.description: Apache Pinot - A realtime distributed OLAP datastore

title: [PINOT-7088]Provide a way to no downtime table rebalancing
body:
Currently, when the controller's rebalance API is called, the idealstate is updated in one go and there are no guarantees around replica availability.

This change provides a way to do no downtime rebalancing. Key changes include:
1. Option to specify via rebalance API whether a downtime is acceptable or not. (By default the code does the safe thing: no-downtime rebalance).
2. Provide a helper class to handle the actual ideal-state update actions. This is moved out of the Strategy classes - perhaps a clearer approach as the Strategy classes just inform what needs to be done and the actual execution is handled outside of the Strategy.
3. IdealStateUpdater class: This class does the no-downtime update using a fixed thread pool - this allows for the API to return the target IdealState to the user and handle the execution in the background. The no downtime aspect is handled thus:
- The ideal state is updated to reflect the target state first by doing one change at a time. For ex, if current state is Segment 1 -> {host1:online, host2:online} and new state is Segment 1 -> {host3:online, host4:online}, we transition through the following changes:
Segment 1 -> {host1:online, host2:online, host3:online} => Segment 1 -> {host1:online, host2:online,host3:online, host4:online}
Transitions for all segments are triggered in each pass, but each segment will handle just one transition.
- After this the ideal state is set to the target which will result in removing segments from the current servers: Segment1 -> {host3:online, host4:online}

Testing done:
- Manual testing at this point to ensure:
1. API return immediately
2. Table with ReplicaGroupAssignmentStrategy can be rebalanced correctly when instances per partition are changed (ie, added or removed).

TODO: Update unit tests to cover the new logic. Subsequent commits will address this.

title: [TE] pinot - support topk limit for groupby queries
body: ThirdEye's Pinot connector currently does not allow us to dynamically change the TOP K limit, which is hard-coded to 100000 elements. This becomes a huge performance burden on de-aggregation queries of data sets with high cardinality, e.g. for rendering the heat map. This PR adds support to limit the number of elements in the response

title: Forcing file permissions of staging dir to be user-set in hadoop
body:
* Forcing the staging directory upon segment creation to have the permission that the user sets in fs.permissions.umask-mode. Defaults to null if not set.
* Thanks to Jonathan Hung for the investigation:
Due to some FileSystem caching that hadoop does, we have problems setting permissions on files. When FileSystem.get is called, it will search for a cached instance in its internal map, but it doesnt use the conf when generating the key. So probably somewhere before this code is called there was already a FileSystem created (with default umask 027) which is being used when the staging dir is created.

title: Convert byte[] defaultNull values into String equivalents during Schema serialization.
body:
Since defaultNullValue is stored as an Object in FieldSpec, and for
BYTES data type the Object type is byte[], we need to convert it into
String value when need. This also helps serialize and deserialize the
schema correctly.

Added unit test to cover serialization/deserialization of schema
for various defaultNullValues.

repo.description: Apache Pinot - A realtime distributed OLAP datastore

title: CSV Reader Config when Creating Segments from CSV using Hadoop
body:
Currently you can specify a readerconfig when creating segments using pinot-admin.sh, but this argument is not available when creating segments using the hadoop jar command. I added code so that you can specify a readerconfig filepath in job.properties. Not sure why the spacing ended up off within getReaderConfig.

It may be a good idea to also allow job.properties to specify the expected file format. The current way that Hadoop SegmentCreation reads file formats gives problems e.g. when uploading a .tsv file; this PR now allows reading files with any delimiter, but they still have to have a .csv file extension.

title: Adding tenant to table mapping API
body:
* Currently, it is not easy to get all the tables of a certain tenant. You have to start by getting the instances and manually finding the tables on those instances.
* This API will look at table config in zk and gather the tables that are tagged with the particular tenant.

title: [TE] Add support for cc and bcc recipients in the legacy pipeline
body:
**Changes:**
* Added cc & bcc support in the backend legacy pipeline.
* Support to configure cc & bcc fields in the Edit Notification Settings.
* Display the recipients (to, cc & bcc) on the Alert Creation Page. No option added to configure cc & bcc from here.
* Alert config example:
```
    "receiverAddresses": {
        "to": [
            "abc@linkedin.com",
            "def@linkedin.com"
        ],
        "cc": [
            "xyz@linkedin.com",
            "pqr@linkedin.com"
        ],
        "bcc": []
    },
```
* Instance is deployed on my machine. ('http://\<you-know-my-user-id\>-ld2:4200')

**Testing:**
* Unit tests updated
* Verified emails are sent correctly through local deployment

title: [TE] detection - legacy emulation compensate lossy merger
